channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: No money to staff children's units at new Christchurch Hospital: 'They will remain empty'
item.description: New services to improve emergency and acute care of children at Christchurch Hospital will not open because there is no money to staff them.

item.title: Ship carrying two NZ crew members and live export missing in East China Sea
item.description: A ship carrying 43 crew members, two from New Zealand, and 5800 New Zealand cows has gone missing in the East China Sea.

item.title: Live Covid-19 updates from New Zealand and around the world on 3 September
item.description: Australia is officially in its first recession for almost three decades, New Zealand's conference sector is calling for support, and a new study finds fewer Covid patients die when given steroids.

item.title: Academics demand racism within University of Waikato be dealt with
item.description: Allegations of casual and structural racism within the University of Waikato have been met with resounding silence from the university's leaders, Professor of Indigenous Education Linda Tuhiwai Smith says.

item.title: Yachties concerned new Cook Strait ferries could end racing in Wellington's inner harbour
item.description: Yachties fear KiwiRail's two new mammoth Cook Strait ferries will spell the end of racing in Wellington's inner harbour.

item.title: Large fire breaks out at campervan rental facility in Māngere, South Auckland
item.description: The fire at the campervan rental facility has been contained, with limited damage to motorhomes but the building has been gutted.

item.title: Thousands of GP nurses on strike in bid for pay parity
item.description: NZNO says its members are "extremely disappointed and frustrated" at the lack of action to date and that the problem does require the government to get involved.

item.title: Fewer Covid-19 patients die when given steroids, study shows
item.description: There would be 20 percent fewer deaths from Covid-19 if steroids were part of standard care for critically ill patients, according to a new study.

item.title: Some Wellington bus commuters face long waits due to physical distancing rules
item.description: Some commuters in the capital are facing frustratingly long waits for buses this week as mass masking became mandatory.

item.title: Covid Tracer app: 2.1 million downloads, but who is signing in?
item.description: It is back to basics with the government's latest Covid-19 tracking tool - a paper pamphlet to be used by anyone who does not have a smartphone.

item.title: Covid-19: What happened in New Zealand on 2 September
item.description: There were five new cases of Covid-19 in New Zealand today, moving to alert level 1 is still some way off and a Retail NZ report shows business confidence has taken a hammering.

item.title: Ruataniwha dam backers refuse to take 'dead horse' off the table
item.description: A Hawke's Bay Regional councillor fears authorities have given "mouth to mouth to a rotting corpse" over a controversial strategy to fix water storage in Central Hawke's Bay.

item.title: Hunt on for Crump and Scotty's 1980s utes
item.description: Toyota is trying to track down the utes from a series of 1980s TV ads that featured Barry Crump and his city slicker sidekick Lloyd 'Scotty' Scott careering cross-country adventures.

item.title: Mount Ruapehu's skifields latest to be hit by cyber attacks
item.description: Ruapehu Alpine Lifts says the deliberate attack failed and the parking system was back online a few minutes later.

item.title: High-profile sportsman tries again for name suppression
item.description: A high-profile sportsman's bid for name suppression has come before the Court of Appeal - again - in the latest chapter of his fight to keep his identity secret forever.

item.title: Julia Deans announced as music director for the 2020 Silver Scrolls
item.description: As music director for the Silver Scrolls, Deans will be responsible for all the performances throughout the ceremony, which each year sees a surprise lineup of musicians covering the finalist and winning songs.

item.title: Darfield, Christchurch, Cook Strait, Kaikōura: A decade of earthquakes
item.description: Our Changing World - In this earthquake special, three GNS Science seismologists from GeoNet recollect their experience of the Big Ones and talk about the lessons learned.

item.title: UK study reveals higher risk from Covid-19 for pregnant women
item.description: The study published today in the British Medical Journal shows pregnant women are at a higher risk from the effects of Covid-19 and more likely to give birth early.
